conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light; shape and size depend on object shape and light source position.
Position of shadow is determined by direction of light rays relative to the object.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are currently cast behind the objects, indicating light source is in front.
Moving light source forward means light rays come from a position closer to the objects.
Change in light source position affects both position and size of shadows.
As light source moves forward, shadows shift closer to objects due to steeper angle of light rays.
Size of shadows will decrease as light source gets closer, increasing angle of light rays relative to ground.
Position Change: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move closer to their respective objects.
Size Change: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become smaller.
Final Answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift closer to the objects and become smaller.
